Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel RT (Live Patch 2 for SLE 15 SP7)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel RT (Live Patch 2 for SLE 15 SP7)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 6.4.0-150700_7_8 fixes several issues.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2025-38212: ipc: fix to protect IPCS lookups using RCU (bsc#1246030).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 15 SP7

Vulnerabilities.Description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

ipc: fix to protect IPCS lookups using RCU

syzbot reported that it discovered a use-after-free vulnerability, [0]

[0]: https://lore.kernel.org/all/67af13f8.050a0220.21dd3.0038.GAE@google.com/

idr_for_each() is protected by rwsem, but this is not enough.  If it is
not protected by RCU read-critical region, when idr_for_each() calls
radix_tree_node_free() through call_rcu() to free the radix_tree_node
structure, the node will be freed immediately, and when reading the next
node in radix_tree_for_each_slot(), the already freed memory may be read.

Therefore, we need to add code to make sure that idr_for_each() is
protected within the RCU read-critical region when we call it in
shm_destroy_orphaned().
